Howard.Action: Raises his hands and pleads for Michelle to stop attacking him, tries to communicate calmly despite being assaulted.
Enters the locked room uninvited, causing Michelle to panic and attack him.
Calmly raises his hands and verbally tries to de-escalate the situation when attacked.
Rolls out of the way to avoid a potentially serious blow, then disarms Michelle by grabbing the two-by-four.
Allows himself to be hit in the forearm by Michelle's initial attack, showing some physical resilience but also a moment of vulnerability.
Says 'I’m only trying to help you!' while blocking the doorway and holding a two-by-four, then drops the weapon and later provides food and bandages Michelle's injury.
Blocks Michelle's escape and pursues her despite her pleas to stay away, causing her to black out from pain.
Sits quietly by the door, bandaged from injury, and advises Michelle to eat the food he provided, showing concern for her well-being.
Dismisses Michelle's call to the police and insists she doesn't understand the situation, maintaining control over her.
Blocks the doorway to prevent Michelle from escaping, showing physical control and assertiveness.
Drops the two-by-four when Michelle reaches for the shovel, then takes the shovel himself, demonstrating adaptability and control of the situation.
Provides food and tends to his own injury with a bandage, indicating self-care and preparedness.
Speaks with intelligence and a weary, hard-to-read demeanor, suggesting mental acuity and experience.
Fails to effectively communicate or convince Michelle of his intentions, leading to increased panic and distrust.
Uses intimidation and physical dominance rather than clear explanation or reassurance, which may undermine his credibility.
Came across Michelle's wrecked car and did not leave her there.
Spent all night setting Michelle's leg and closing her head wound.
Explains he locked Michelle up for her own safety and to prevent her from wandering off or hurting him.
Tells Michelle she can't leave because of poisonous chemicals outside and offers a filtration system for protection.
Offers Michelle painkillers and leaves the choice up to her.
Uses humor to lighten the mood despite tense situation.
Sets Michelle's leg and closes her head wound, showing medical skill and care.
Explains the presence of poisonous chemicals outside and the filtration system protecting the bunker.
Admits to being a veterinarian when Michelle questions his medical credentials, showing honesty and some confidence.
Locks Michelle in the room against her will, indicating controlling behavior and possibly poor judgment in trust-building.
Fails to convincingly reassure Michelle, who remains highly suspicious and distrustful.
Offers Ketamine as a painkiller and leaves the choice to Michelle, showing some respect for her autonomy.
Rubs his bandaged arm and mentions needing sleep, which may indicate vulnerability or distraction.
Acknowledges he went too far after making a disturbing comment and encourages Michelle to eat and sleep, offering to be nearby if she needs anything.
Makes a threatening and unsettling comment about drugging Michelle and controlling her, causing her distress.
Explains his method of drugging logically and calmly, showing awareness of how to control the situation.
Recognizes he went too far and attempts to de-escalate by telling Michelle to eat and sleep, showing some emotional intelligence and control.
Leaves the door open and tells Michelle to call if she needs anything, indicating some confidence and control over the environment.
Carries and provides rudimentary but functional crutches to Michelle.
Reaches to steady Michelle but respects her pulling away by not forcing contact and leading the way out.
Shows Michelle the bathroom and accommodations, allowing her some privacy by leaving the room when she requests it.
Stands just outside the bathroom curtain instead of leaving immediately, potentially invading privacy.
Constructs functional crutches from rudimentary materials that are nonetheless impressive.
Leads Michelle through the bunker, showing her the rooms and facilities including a bathroom.
Respects Michelle's request for privacy by closing the door when exiting the bathroom.
Attempts to steady Michelle by reaching for her arm despite her pulling away.
Looks in Michelle's purse to find her name and calls her by it, showing attentiveness and a desire to connect.
Watches Michelle silently without intervening or explaining when she tries the locked door, showing restraint and respect for her space.
Provides detailed information about the shelter and its provisions, demonstrating transparency and a willingness to share important information.
Converted his cellar into a fully self-contained fallout shelter with solar power, water filtration, and stocked supplies.
Knows Michelle's name by looking in her purse, indicating resourcefulness but also a breach of privacy.
Listens at the door and almost tumbles in, showing eagerness but a lack of subtlety.
Reaches out to comfort Michelle when she is upset about her mother, showing empathy.
Fights back his own emotions when talking about his daughter, indicating vulnerability and sincerity.
Tries to stop Michelle from going outside for safety reasons, showing concern.
After Michelle accuses him, he shows a flash of anger and pulls the couch to block the stairs, creating a physical barrier.
Keeps his distance but allows Michelle to go upstairs and look outside, showing some trust or willingness to let her see for herself.
Able to pick up a distant radio station to gather information about the outside world and decide to get to the bunker quickly.
Shows emotional restraint by fighting back his own emotions when discussing his daughter and the situation.
Attempts to comfort Michelle despite the tense situation, showing some social awareness and control.
Pulls the couch away from the stairs to block Michelle, maintaining control of the environment and preventing her from leaving easily.
Keeps his distance while letting Michelle investigate the door and window, showing cautiousness and control.
His face shows a blank slate and then anger when confronted, indicating some loss of emotional control.
Shows Michelle the outside damage and explains the danger calmly and informatively, using a Geiger counter to assess the situation.
Expresses uncertainty about what happened to Mildred and Frank, admits he does not know.
Mentions a prayer quietly to himself ('God grant me the serenity...'), indicating internal struggle or seeking calm.
Warns Michelle firmly that they cannot open the door due to chemical danger, showing concern for her safety.
Uses a Geiger counter and other makeshift equipment to detect radiation and chemical agents, demonstrating technical knowledge and caution.
Admits uncertainty about what caused the gruesome deaths, showing honesty and realistic assessment of his knowledge.
Warns Michelle about the danger outside and insists the door must not be opened, showing prudence and protective instincts.
Mumbles a prayer to himself, which may indicate stress or lack of full control in the situation.
Is shoved down the stairs by Michelle, losing physical control momentarily.
Blocks the stairwell, preventing Michelle from leaving, responds angrily to her pleas for help.
Leans in close to Michelle, breathes in her ear, causing her to cower; his hand reaches toward her but does not touch her.
Switches off the Geiger counter after approaching Michelle, possibly to calm her or reduce her distress.
Warns Michelle that opening the door will let in danger and possibly kill her, showing concern for her safety despite his controlling behavior.
Blocks the stairwell to prevent Michelle from escaping, showing physical control and awareness of his environment.
Calmly switches off the Geiger counter to avoid alarming Michelle, demonstrating situational awareness and control.
Uses psychological tactics to intimidate Michelle into compliance, indicating strategic thinking.
Fiddles with a broken radio but fails to get it working, showing limited technical success.
Expresses anger and frustration vocally, which may undermine his authoritative presence.
Stands silently in the doorway watching Michelle sleep, then leaves without speaking.
Checks on Michelle in the bathroom by asking if she is alright.
Attempts small talk during dinner to engage Michelle.
Bites his tongue and pushes away from the table after Michelle's cold response.
Stands silently in the doorway observing Michelle without confrontation, then walks away without escalating tension.
Attempts small talk with Michelle to ease tension, but stops when conversation turns uncomfortable.
Keeps a watchful presence over Michelle, asking if she is alright in the bathroom, showing attentiveness.
Does not engage or respond when Michelle is distant or uncooperative, possibly missing an opportunity to connect or assert control.
Carefully unwraps Michelle's bandage despite her pain and rewraps her wound with a clean bandage.
Insists Michelle take antibiotics to prevent her wound from worsening, showing concern for her health.
Ignores Michelle's plea to go to a hospital and dismisses her need for a real doctor.
Uses a threatening tone implying he might have to amputate her leg if she refuses medicine.
Mentions he is 'stuck down here too' when leaving, indicating a shared predicament.
Inspects and treats Michelle's wound carefully, rewraps it with a clean bandage.
Pressures Michelle to take antibiotics, showing awareness of medical risks like gangrene and amputation.
Ignores Michelle's insistence on going to a hospital, possibly indicating overconfidence or controlling behavior.
Questions Michelle about hiding antibiotics, demonstrating vigilance and control over resources.
Leaves Michelle alone after bandaging her, showing some trust or confidence in her ability to manage.
Snores loudly and is unaware of Michelle's actions around him, indicating a lack of vigilance or alertness.
Explains the ventilation problem clearly and tries to manage limited resources to keep everyone safe.
Acknowledges the difficulty of the situation with a somber tone and shares the burden of survival with Michelle.
Makes a small joke about buying candy bars next time, attempting to lighten the mood.
Stares at the tape on Michelle’s crutches while speaking, possibly indicating a moment of silent judgment or discomfort.
Stops Michelle from drinking alcohol, saying 'You’re not old enough for that' and refuses to drink himself.
Eats his meal quietly while Michelle struggles to open the wine, showing little engagement or encouragement.
Holds his hand over the glass when Michelle tries to pour him wine, indicating he does not want to drink.
Tells Michelle 'You’ve had enough' when she is tipsy, showing concern for her well-being.
Recognizes the danger of carbon dioxide poisoning and explains it.
Picks up a fork and starts eating calmly despite the tense situation.
Refuses to drink wine and maintains self-control when Michelle drinks.
Admits he has never opened a bottle of wine down there and does not have a corkscrew.
Does not intervene effectively when Michelle is trying to open the wine bottle unconventionally.
Warns Michelle she has had enough to drink, showing some awareness of the situation.
Watches Michelle intently as she struggles without her crutches, showing concern.
Gets up and removes the blockage in the air vent to improve air flow, despite being furious.
Expresses suspicion and frustration toward Michelle, implying distrust.
Mentions his past help and sacrifices to Michelle in a frustrated tone.
Uses a shovel to tap and investigate the air duct, finds a blockage, and removes it to restore airflow.
Keeps a locked closet with a shovel and other supplies, indicating preparedness and resourcefulness.
Expresses suspicion and frustration when Michelle acts against his instructions, showing awareness and control over the environment.
Shrugs off questions about his past and avoids sharing information, which may indicate evasiveness or lack of transparency.
Pulled Michelle from a crushed car, kept her safe, gave her antibiotics despite limited supply.
Expresses resentment that Michelle tries to kill them despite his help.
Knocks aside Michelle's crutch when she threatens him, escalating confrontation.
Throws down the shovel and offers Michelle the key to leave, effectively freeing her.
Warns Michelle she cannot return and that leaving will likely kill her, showing concern for his own safety but also giving her a choice.
Rescues Michelle from a crushed car, provides antibiotics from limited supplies, and keeps her safe from outside dangers.
Knocks aside Michelle's crutch with a shovel confidently during confrontation, showing physical control and assertiveness.
Offers Michelle the key to leave the bunker, demonstrating control over the situation and a calculated decision to let her go on his terms.
Warns Michelle about the dangers outside and sets clear boundaries, showing awareness and strategic thinking.
His voice wavers between menace and regret when telling Michelle she can't come back, indicating some emotional conflict but maintaining control.
Urgently warns Michelle not to open the door to a stranger in a hazmat suit, showing concern for her safety.
Turns valves on the ducts to clean the suit off, taking practical steps to protect others.
Nods unhappily when asked about Nate, indicating some discomfort or distrust but not hostility.
Disappears down the stairwell after Nate enters, avoiding confrontation or explanation.
Rushes to warn Michelle not to open the door when a suspicious man appears outside.
Immediately takes action to clean the contaminated suit by running water over it, showing knowledge of contamination protocols.
Disappears down the stairwell after Nate enters, not intervening further in the immediate confrontation.
Runs water over the suit and scrubs it carefully, showing concern about contamination.
Closes the faucet to prevent contamination and instructs to try the sink instead.
Pays no attention to Michelle while she washes herself down, focusing solely on cleaning the suit.
Stares tensely at the name inside the suit, showing a moment of emotional reaction.
Speaks in tense whispers with Nate, indicating strained relations and possible distrust.
Says 'Got some nerve showing up here now' to Nate, showing hostility.
Recognizes potential contamination in the water and shuts off the faucet to prevent further exposure.
Suggests trying the sink as an alternative water source when the tub faucet is closed.
Focuses on thoroughly cleaning the hazmat suit, turning it inside out to scrub all parts.
Does not intervene or assist when Michelle is hesitant or confused about washing herself down, showing some detachment.
Shows tension and discomfort upon seeing the name inside the hazmat suit, indicating possible emotional distraction.
Stares at Nate suspiciously and makes a sarcastic underbreath comment about Michelle being 'ecstatic' about ignorance.
Acknowledges Nate's help in building the place, despite Nate ignoring him.
Interrupts a moment of connection between Michelle and Nate with a question about conditions outside.
Acknowledges Nate's contribution to building the bunker, showing awareness and giving credit.
Expresses doubt and suspicion about Nate and Michelle's story, indicating cautiousness and critical thinking.
Under his breath, makes a sarcastic comment about Michelle's ignorance, showing some emotional control but also a negative attitude.
Interrupts a social moment between Nate and Michelle, possibly undermining social tact and confidence.
Rescues Michelle and keeps her safe.
Expresses frustration that Michelle refuses to believe him but trusts a stranger's story.
Strongly forbids Michelle from going outside to fix the ventilation system, citing safety concerns.
Shows concern about limited resources and safety of the group.
Grits his teeth and looks at Michelle and Nate closely, possibly indicating jealousy or distrust.
Insists that he decides who stays in the cellar, asserting control over others' presence.
Exhales irritably and closes the mask without responding to Nate's suggestion to get fresh air.
Looks back as the cellar door slams shut after he leaves, showing a moment of hesitation or concern.
Carefully frees himself from a bent nail on the roof, showing caution and self-preservation but no direct warmth toward others.
Insists on making decisions about who can stay in the cellar, asserting control over the situation.
Is described by Nate as 'good with machines' and capable of fixing the problem in the cellar.
Climbs carefully on the barn roof, notices a hazard (bent nail) and avoids damaging his suit, showing caution and awareness.
Exhales irritably and closes the mask without responding to Nate's provocation, showing emotional control but possibly avoidance.
Shoves a fallen tree branch off the solar panels to maintain their function.
Locks a revolver and ammo in a safe, then hides them in a trash bag and later wraps the gun in a towel before hiding it in the bathtub.
Gives Nate and Michelle a thumbs up as he rushes past them.
Responds to Michelle's question about seeing anything outside with a brief, possibly evasive 'Nope... Nothing...'.
Carefully removes a branch blocking solar panels and inspects damage, showing awareness and caution.
Freezes and looks around after making noise, showing alertness and situational awareness.
Wipes fog from mask to improve vision and attempts to identify distant object, demonstrating practical problem-solving.
Retrieves revolver and ammo from safe, then hides them in a trash bag and later wraps the gun in a towel before hiding it in the tub, indicating careful planning and concealment.
Locks cellar door behind him when entering, showing security awareness.
Gives Nate and Michelle a thumbs up while rushing past, possibly to reassure them despite tense situation, showing some confidence.
When asked if he sees anything outside, he pauses and then says 'Nope... Nothing....' which may indicate cautious withholding of information or uncertainty.
Wipes the bag of chocolates clean and throws it to Michelle with a smile, calling it dessert.
Watches Michelle fill wine glasses with disappointment, showing some emotional expression but no direct interaction.
Rolls his eyes and looks suspiciously at Nate's food presentation, showing skepticism rather than friendliness.
Engages in tense eye contact and a subtle power struggle with Nate, indicating guardedness and possible distrust.
Pulls out chocolates from a sealed bag, cleans them, and offers them as dessert with a smile.
Rolls his eyes and watches Nate suspiciously, questioning him about the hazmat suit and probing his story.
Engages in a tense stare-down with Nate, showing awareness and caution.
Buys dinner and insists Nate wash the dishes.
Quietly reminds Nate that he is a guest in his cellar and that the wine belongs to him.
Avoids engaging with Nate's challenge and walks away to his room.
Revealed to have a tragic past involving his wife's death and possible suspicious circumstances.
Lies about having a daughter in Washington, D.C.
Insists on ownership and control of the wine cellar, asserting boundaries with Nate quietly but firmly.
Avoids direct confrontation by walking away and closing his door instead of addressing the tension openly.
Struggles to cover up irritation when challenged about the wine tasting, showing some emotional vulnerability.
Grabs crackers and sits quietly, staring daggers at Nate, showing protective vigilance over Michelle.
Eats crackers while staring at Michelle after she passes out, indicating concern or watchfulness.
Smiles each time Nate winces while hammering nails, showing possible sadistic pleasure or hostility.
Tells Nate Michelle is throwing up and sarcastically says 'You must be proud of yourself,' indicating bitterness or resentment.
Says 'So you finally believe me' to Michelle, implying a desire to be trusted or validated.
Opens his door and calmly enters the room, grabs crackers, and sits down while maintaining a hostile stare at Nate.
Continues hammering nails despite Nate's obvious discomfort and requests to stop, showing focus and persistence.
Responds to Nate's question about time with a dismissive answer, 'Does it matter?,' indicating possible disregard for situational awareness.
Keeps a big smile on his face while hammering nails as Nate winces, suggesting emotional detachment or possible sadism rather than practical focus.
Repairs the broken frame on a solar panel to make it functional temporarily.
Locks Nate in the stairwell after sending him out in a hazmat suit, showing control and caution.
Identifies inconsistencies in Nate’s story and questions his trustworthiness based on knowledge and observation.
Warns Michelle about Nate’s violent past and advises caution.
Does not immediately respond to pounding at the stairwell, showing restraint and awareness of potential danger.
Acknowledges water usage problem and attempts to manage resources.
Eventually gets up to open the stairwell door despite warnings, potentially compromising safety.
Offers Michelle an expensive bottle of wine to share, smiles, and toasts with her.
Chugs expensive wine quickly, ignores Nate's suggestion to savor it.
Glares at Michelle and calls her 'princess' in a confrontational tone after she suggests he slow down.
Selects an expensive, rare wine from the cellar and describes it knowledgeably, showing appreciation and confidence in his choice.
Pours and drinks the wine quickly, ignoring social cues and advice to savor it, which may indicate poor self-control or lack of social tact.
Interrupts a social moment by loudly scraping his chair and abruptly changing the atmosphere, showing poor timing and social awareness.
Claims his help is charity and expects gratitude.
Flings wine glass at Nate and physically attacks him after insults.
Claims credit for building the shelter and expects gratitude, showing confidence in his accomplishment.
Admits he could have hired a less competent person and expresses regret, showing some self-awareness.
Loses control and initiates a physical fight while drunk, leading to losing the initiative and getting hurt.
Throws a wine glass aggressively, escalating conflict instead of resolving it calmly.
Allows Michelle to intervene and stop Nate from further violence.
Looks at himself in the mirror and tends to his wounds quietly.
Claims authority over the cellar and threatens Nate with a gun to enforce order.
Shows concern about limited resources ('Too damn many of us down here').
Maintains control and asserts authority by confronting Nate with a revolver and clearly stating he is in charge of the cellar.
Suffers physical harm (glass cuts, bruises) and is unable to prevent Nate's aggression, indicating vulnerability in physical confrontation.
Observes the non-functioning faucet and expresses concern, showing situational awareness and attention to critical survival details.
Retreats to bed after being attacked, possibly indicating a momentary lapse in resilience or inability to immediately respond.
Hands Nate a flashlight and tells him to go first into the crawl space, then instructs Michelle to stay by the door and alert him if she sees water running through the yard.
Removes a throw rug to reveal a hidden trap door, directs Nate to enter first with a flashlight, and assigns Michelle a lookout position.
Hands Michelle a bottle of wine and a glass, attempting a small gesture of hospitality.
Comments on the wine being 'a little off' and tries to make light of the situation, showing some social awareness.
Does not engage in conversation or show concern when Michelle and Nate discuss his past actions and instability, remaining silent and unconscious after drinking.
His past behavior as described by Michelle and Nate includes running Michelle off the road and planning to bring her to the bunker as a 'plaything,' indicating controlling and abusive tendencies.
Identifies the pump as busted and acknowledges the problem with the engine.
Calmly offers wine to Michelle, maintaining composure despite tense situation.
Detects that the wine might be corked by smelling and tasting it.
Fails to notice Michelle slipping Ketamine into his wine, leading to him becoming unconscious.
Becomes unconscious after drinking the drugged wine, losing control of the situation.
Watches Michelle covertly as she passes by in her panties.
Drinks wine alone, appears withdrawn and brooding.
Feigns being unconscious to covertly observe Michelle.
Realizes his gun is missing and pieces together what happened.
Passively drinks wine and does not confront Nate directly when his gun is taken.
Hands over keys to Nate under threat of gun despite tension.
Accuses Nate of lying to Michelle and tries to defend himself as having 'done a lot' for her.
Shows anger and frustration when confronted by Michelle about his actions.
Refuses to give keys initially, shows defiance under threat.
Eventually hands over keys when threatened with gun, avoiding immediate harm.
Attempts to manipulate Michelle by appealing to past favors and denying wrongdoing.
Fails to maintain control of situation as Nate escalates and gains upper hand.
Sneers at Nate and calls him a bastard for taking over the shelter.
Pulls himself up through the trap door and closes it, maintaining the shelter's order.
Sits with Nate and Michelle to share a meal, drinking wine with them.
Inspects the water system by going down into the crawl space and confirms it should be working.
Sneers at Nate and shows hostility instead of cooperating.
Drinks wine during a tense meal, possibly indicating poor judgment or coping mechanism.
Admits to jealousy and reveals the truth about the staged attack to Michelle, offering to help her escape by calling the police if she gives him the keys.
Leans in close to Michelle and speaks in a hushed whisper, creating an intense and somewhat threatening atmosphere.
Admits the truth about the fake attack and tries to convince Michelle to help him escape by offering a plan to call the police.
Reveals jealousy and personal motives that may undermine trust and cooperation.
Attempts to negotiate and strategize with Michelle, showing some level of planning and persuasion.
Relies on Michelle to take action first, showing some passivity or dependence on others to execute plans.
Complies with Nate's order to leave the keys on the table without argument.
Attempts to leave the bunker wearing a hazmat suit, indicating concern for safety and responsibility.
Does not confront Nate or Michelle aggressively when stopped, instead turns back quietly.
Wears a hazmat suit and attempts to check the solar panels despite Nate's hostility, showing awareness of potential danger and a plan to maintain cover story.
Complies with Nate's demand to leave the keys on the table and abandons the suit, indicating submission and avoidance of direct conflict.
Snores loudly and has two empty wine bottles next to his bed, suggesting possible neglect of self-discipline or impaired alertness.
Leers at Michelle with drunken eyes and blocks her path to the door.
Verbally abuses Michelle, calling her a 'bitch' and blaming her for trouble.
Physically grabs Michelle around the neck with a crazed look.
Does not show remorse or attempt to de-escalate after being hit and knocked down.
Attempts to grab a wine bottle from Michelle after she pours out bottles, ignoring her command not to touch her.
Avoids impact of wine bottle swung at him by Michelle.
Blocks Michelle’s path to the door, physically restraining her.
Leers at Michelle with drunken eyes, showing impaired judgment.
Grabs Michelle around the neck in a crazed manner, escalating violence irrationally.
Wobbles to his feet after being hit on the head, showing physical resilience but unsteady.
Hurries to grab a wine bottle from Michelle’s hand, attempting to control the situation.
Says he would never attack Michelle and apologizes for getting emotional.
Reaches out to Michelle but she backs away, indicating a lack of trust or warmth perceived by her.
Pleading with Nate not to hurt him, sobbing hysterically and promising to do anything to avoid conflict.
Does not assert himself or protect Michelle, instead begging and showing fear under Nate's aggression.
Tries to de-escalate the situation by apologizing and denying accusations, attempts to reach out to Michelle.
Begs and pleads hysterically when threatened with violence, shows emotional breakdown and inability to control the situation.
Backs away and stumbles under pressure, fails to assert himself or take control.
Looks up to Nate with pleading eyes, says thank you after being pushed down stairs.
Sits at edge of bed with a feral look in his eyes, not moving an inch after confrontation.
Mulls over his answer when Michelle asks about Nate's whereabouts, then gives a vague response.
Looks up to Nate with pleading eyes and thanks him after being pushed down the stairs, showing awareness of social dynamics and restraint.
Sits at the edge of his bed motionless with a feral look in his eyes, indicating internal turmoil and lack of control.
Fiddles with the radio in the morning, demonstrating engagement with his environment and some technical skill.
Mulls over his answer when Michelle asks about Nate's whereabouts, showing cautiousness and thoughtfulness in communication.
Explains his worldview about human nature and the attack, emphasizing harsh truths and selfishness of people.
Warns Michelle that denial puts her in danger, trying to make her face reality.
Explains the rationale behind his preparations and worldview, showing awareness of societal issues and anticipating crisis scenarios.
Responds vaguely about the missing person outside, giving no clear plan or timeline, which may indicate uncertainty or lack of control.
Says to Michelle 'I’m not going to do anything to you. I’d never hurt you. You’re like my own daughter.'
Tells Michelle to stop crying and says 'I’m trying to help you. That’s all I’ve ever done...'
Lies to Michelle about Nate and his intentions, admits to lying to get keys and escape.
Avoids physical comfort when Michelle cries, knowing better than to approach.
Flips off the lights and instructs Michelle to be quiet when danger approaches.
Calmly reads on the couch and responds to Michelle's questions with controlled answers.
Admits to lying earlier to Michelle in order to get the keys and escape a threat.
Reassures Michelle he won't hurt her and tries to comfort her despite her distress.
Flips off the lights and instructs Michelle to stay quiet when a vehicle approaches, showing situational awareness.
Fails to fully convince Michelle of his intentions, leading to her emotional breakdown and distrust.
Tackles Michelle to prevent her from calling for help, forcibly restrains her, and injects her with a sedative despite her resistance.
Watches Michelle with a sad look on his face after sedating her.
Moves slowly and methodically toward Michelle, anticipating danger and controlling the situation by silencing her and restraining her when she tries to call for help.
Uses a syringe to sedate Michelle effectively during a tense moment, preventing her from alerting whoever is outside.
Maintains composure and control under pressure, watching Michelle with a sad look but not losing focus on the situation.
Reassures Michelle after rescuing her from the car crash, saying 'Don't worry. Everything's going to be alright.'
Locks Michelle in the room, requiring her to bang on the door to be let out.
Questions Michelle about opening wine on her birthday and takes the bottle from her, showing some restraint.
Lets go of the wine bottle when Michelle puts her hand over his, indicating some respect for her wishes.
Successfully pries open the car door to rescue Michelle despite difficult conditions.
Keeps Michelle locked in a room with a deadbolt, showing control over the environment.
Notices the wine bottles Michelle pulls out and questions their origin, showing awareness.
Tempted by the wine but restrains himself when Michelle asserts herself, showing self-control and social awareness.
Expression is hard to read when rescuing Michelle, possibly indicating emotional ambiguity or lack of clear communication.
Agrees to have a drink with Michelle on her birthday despite initial reluctance.
Encourages Michelle to open another bottle when she dislikes the wine.
Comments humorously about the mixed wine making a decent rose, sharing a light moment with Michelle.
Gently warns Michelle about drinking too much, showing concern for her wellbeing.
Takes Michelle to her room and helps her lie down when she is too drunk to stay awake, showing care and attentiveness.
Resists temptation to drink initially, then drinks moderately and responsibly.
Encourages Michelle to open another bottle when she dislikes the wine, showing decisiveness.
Observes Michelle carefully and warns her when she stumbles, showing attentiveness and care.
Demonstrates knowledge about wine by mixing Chardonnay and Shiraz and commenting on the result.
Takes responsibility to help Michelle to bed when she is too intoxicated, maintaining control despite being slightly wobbly.
Appears a bit wobbly himself after drinking, indicating some loss of control.
Gently pulls a blanket over Michelle as she sinks into bed, watches her with a soft, wistful look.
Takes Michelle's driver’s license from her purse without permission and coldly comments about her birthday and wine.
Locks Michelle’s door from outside, restricting her freedom.
Sits alone drinking wine, appearing disappointed and despondent.
Gently pulls a blanket over Michelle as she sinks into bed, showing care and attentiveness.
Takes Michelle's driver's license and coldly comments on the situation, indicating control and awareness of the circumstances.
Locks Michelle's door securely with a deadbolt, demonstrating precaution and planning.
Sits down and drinks wine alone, eventually falling asleep and snoring at the table, leaving Michelle unattended.
Lies passed out and half-asleep while Michelle frantically searches for the key and tries to escape.
Wakes up and notices the vent being kicked out but does not immediately intervene or help.
Is passed out and half-asleep while Michelle searches for the key and tries to escape.
Wakes up fully upon hearing the vent being kicked and quickly locates the kicked out vent in the trap door area.
Urgently calls Michelle back inside, warning her it’s not safe.
Hesitates when seeing the dead pigs outside, showing a moment of pause.
Scrambles quickly to find the closet door open and notices the missing gun and hazmat suit, showing alertness and situational awareness.
Finds the cellar door key quickly by searching under the mattress, demonstrating resourcefulness and quick thinking.
Opens the cellar door and exits wrapped in a blanket, then scans the yard carefully, showing caution and awareness.
Hesitates for a long moment after seeing the dead pigs, indicating possible uncertainty or fear.
Calls out to Michelle urgently to get back inside, showing leadership and concern for safety.
Glances briefly at Nate’s corpse before making for the house, indicating a momentary distraction but prioritizing action.
Throws himself repeatedly against the back door to get inside, showing persistence.
After forcing the door open, picks up Michelle’s dropped gun and puts it in his pocket instead of using it against her.
Calls out to Michelle to stop and warns her she’s not safe, indicating concern for her safety.
Explains that he killed Nate because Nate was dangerous and that he did it for their safety, attempting to justify his actions and protectiveness.
Kicks the door hard enough to splinter the door jamb and force entry after repeated attempts.
Quickly retrieves the gun Michelle drops and secures it in his pocket.
Follows Michelle’s muddy footprints to keep track of her movements.
Yells warnings to Michelle about danger, showing awareness and attempt to control the situation.
His face is hidden beneath a wet blanket, which may impair his vision and situational awareness.
Says 'You don’t have to love me. You don’t even have to like me, but please. Don’t leave me. I don’t want to be alone. I’ll never hurt you. You can trust me.'
Approaches Michelle from behind and reaches out to stop her from leaving, despite her resistance.
Claims self-defense after being called a murderer.
Moves slowly and talks calmly, attempts to reason with Michelle, showing controlled behavior under stress.
Approaches Michelle from behind to prevent her escape, showing tactical awareness.
Is grazed by a knife but quickly recovers and pulls a gun, demonstrating physical resilience and readiness.
Chases Michelle up the stairs with a revolver, showing persistence and determination.
Is forced to retreat when Michelle topples a cabinet down the stairs, indicating a failure to anticipate or prevent this defensive move.
Admits that pulling the trigger was the hardest thing he's ever done and reflects on feeling emotionally numb since losing his daughter.
Stalks into the bedroom with a gun, searches the house aggressively, and attempts to physically grab Michelle.
Systematically searches the bedroom, checking the closet and bathroom for Michelle.
